com.camerontec.util.guestlogs.filenamingscheme

Interface IFileScanner

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<IFileScanner>

    public interface IFileScanner
extends Comparable<IFileScanner>
    This interface defines file scanners, which are responsible for providing the log reader with PositionInFiles from which to start reading logs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getReadingPosition

        PositionInFile getReadingPosition(ILineParser lineParser,
                                  long timestamp)
                           throws IOException
        Finds the next PositionInFile after the given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        lineParser - the ILineParser to use to extract timestamps from lines of logs
        timestamp - a number of milliseconds since the Epoch
        Returns:
        the next available PositionInFile after this timestamp
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when attempting to read from a file

      • getReadingPosition

        PositionInFile getReadingPosition(ILineParser lineParser,
                                  LogEventID logEventID)
                           throws IOException
        Finds the next PositionInFile after the given LogEventID.
        Parameters:
        lineParser - the ILineParser to use to extract timestamps from lines of logs
        logEventID - a LogEventID representing the ID of the last log event processed by the log reader
        Returns:
        the next available PositionInFile after logEventID
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when attempting to read from a file

      • getReadingPosition

        PositionInFile getReadingPosition(ILineParser lineParser,
                                  PositionInFile position)
                           throws IOException
        Finds the next PositionInFile after the given PositionInFile.
        Parameters:
        lineParser - the ILineParser to use to extract timestamps from lines of logs
        position - the PositionInFile of the last line read
        Returns:
        the next available PositionInFile after position
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when attempting to read from a file

      • setLogger

        Parameters:
        logger - the logger to use

      • getLowerBoundLogTimestamp

        long getLowerBoundLogTimestamp(ILineParser lineParser)
                        throws IOException
        Return the time stamp of the log entry with the lowest time stamp across all log files. This is used by logs replication to keep the rewritten high performance log files in sync with the guest log files. Any high performance log entries with a lower time stamp than reported by this function will be pruned.
        Parameters:
        lineParser - the ILineParser to use to extract timestamps from lines of logs
        Returns:
        The lower bound log entry timestamp. All high performance log events with a timestamp less than this are deleted.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs when attempting to read from a file
